description: Microsoft created the ISF format for use with the Windows Ink Service Platform, which is a framework that allows Windows apps to accept and show stylus input. Several mobile and desktop versions of Windows, including Windows 7 and later desktop versions, include the Windows Ink Service Platform.
When the Windows Ink Service Platform detects stylus input, it saves that input to an ISF file. In some versions of Windows, these files are stored in the following location:
